q: Player for nearly 20 minutes, using his quickness to prevent Allen Iverson from even getting the ball, let alone shoot it. He had spent the last two practices impersonating Allen Iverson and apparently got pretty good at it. universe.''[ 2] In that desire to vindicate comes an equal temptation to shape the events favorably, a desire that Donald Rumsfeld seems not to have escaped, as Fred Kaplan points out at Slate: Many autobiographies exhibit[ the tendency to self-aggrandizement] to some extent. It can even be tolerable if it's joined to an engaging style or sage insights about broader matters. Donald Rumsfeld 's book has no such redeeming features. And even if it did, its distortions and lies( I use the term advisedly) are just too blatant to be countenanced. Rebuttal, indeed.[ 1] G.W.
